docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be004.title: BE0044: Error applying Visibility properties: [error]
docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be004.summary: BE0044: Error applying Visibility properties: [error] Error BE0044: Error applying Visibility properties: [error] Cause This error occurs if there is a problem applying any of the Visibility category properties to the reflection information. Solution This most likely indicates an internal error in the build process. Open an issue in the SHFBproject on GitHub containing the details from the error message and attach a small example project with any related files that can be used to duplicate the problem. See Also Concepts Build Engine

docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be004.title: BE0045: Error removing attributes nodes: [error]
docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be004.summary: BE0045: Error removing attributes nodes: [error] Error BE0045: Error removing attributes nodes: [error] Cause This error occurs if there is a problem removing unwanted attributes from the reflection information. Solution This most likely indicates an internal error in the build process. Open an issue in the SHFBproject on GitHub containing the details from the error message and attach a small example project with any related files that can be used to duplicate the problem. See Also Concepts Build Engine

docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be004.title: BE0046: Error removing EII nodes: [error]
docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be004.summary: BE0046: Error removing EII nodes: [error] Error BE0046: Error removing EII nodes: [error] Cause This error occurs if there is a problem removing unwanted explicit interface implementation details from the reflection information. Solution This most likely indicates an internal error in the build process. Open an issue in the SHFBproject on GitHub containing the details from the error message and attach a small example project with any related files that can be used to duplicate the problem. See Also Concepts Build Engine

docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be004.title: BE0047: Error removing inherited members: [error]
docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be004.summary: BE0047: Error removing inherited members: [error] Error BE0047: Error removing inherited members: [error] Cause This error occurs if there is a problem removing unwanted inherited members from the reflection information. Solution This most likely indicates an internal error in the build process. Open an issue in the SHFBproject on GitHub containing the details from the error message and attach a small example project with any related files that can be used to duplicate the problem. See Also Concepts Build Engine

docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be004.title: BE0048: Error removing [memberType]: [error]
docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be004.summary: BE0048: Error removing [memberType]: [error] Error BE0048: Error removing [memberType]: [error] Cause This error occurs if there is a problem removing unwanted items of the indicated member type from the reflection information. Solution This most likely indicates an internal error in the build process. Open an issue in the SHFBproject on GitHub containing the details from the error message and attach a small example project with any related files that can be used to duplicate the problem. See Also Concepts Build Engine

docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be004.title: BE0049: Error changed protected internal to protected: [error]
docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be004.summary: BE0049: Error changed protected internal to protected: [error] Error BE0049: Error changing protected internal to protected: [error] Cause This error occurs if there is a problem converting protected internal members to protected members in the reflection information. Solution This most likely indicates an internal error in the build process. Open an issue in the SHFBproject on GitHub containing the details from the error message and attach a small example project with any related files that can be used to duplicate the problem. See Also Concepts Build Engine

docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be005.title: BE0050: Error removing protected members from sealed classes: [error]
docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be005.summary: BE0050: Error removing protected members from sealed classes: [error] Error BE0050: Error removing protected members from sealed classes: [error] Cause This error occurs if there is a problem removing protected members from sealed classes in the reflection information. Solution This most likely indicates an internal error in the build process. Open an issue in the SHFBproject on GitHub containing the details from the error message and attach a small example project with any related files that can be used to duplicate the problem. See Also Concepts Build Engine

docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be005.title: BE0051: The specified project file does not exist: [projectFile]
docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be005.summary: BE0051: The specified project file does not exist: [projectFile] Error BE0051: The specified project file does not exist: [projectFile] Cause This error occurs if a documentation source or a project reference refers to a project file that does not exist or a solution documentation source contains a reference to a project file that does not exist. Solution Check the documentation sources and references to ensure that the contain references to valid files that do exist. For solution documentation sources, you may need to load them in Visual Studio to determine whether or not they contain valid project references. See Also Concepts Build Engine

docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be005.title: BE0052: One or more token files could not be found
docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be005.summary: BE0052: One or more token files could not be found Error BE0052: One or more token files could not be found Cause This error occurs if one or more project file items with a BuildAction of TokenFile could not be found on disk. Solution Check to be sure that the files physically exist on disk. If the file is no longer used, remove it from the project or change its build action to None so that it is ignored. See Also Concepts Build Engine

docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be005.title: BE0053: One or more code snippets files could not be found
docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be005.summary: BE0053: One or more code snippets files could not be found Error BE0053: One or more code snippets files could not be found Cause This error occurs if one or more project file items with a BuildAction of CodeSnippets could not be found on disk. Solution Check to be sure that the files physically exist on disk. If the file is no longer used, remove it from the project or change its build action to None so that it is ignored. See Also Concepts Build Engine

docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be005.title: BE0054: The conceptual topic '[title]' (ID: [id]) does not match any file in the project
docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be005.summary: BE0054: The conceptual topic '[title]' (ID: [id]) does not match any file in the project Error BE0054: The conceptual topic ' [title] ' (ID: [id]) does not match any file in the project Cause This error occurs if a conceptual content layout file contains a reference to a topic with the given ID and title that does not correspond to a conceptual content topic in the project. Solution Locate the ID in the conceptual content topic and determine whether or not it should have a file associated with it. If no, use the Clear Topic Association context menu option to remove the file association. If a file is supposed to be associated with it, make sure that a topic file with a .aml extension exists in the project. You can use the Associate Topic File context menu option to connect the topic file to the content layout entry. See Also Concepts Build Engine

docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be005.title: BE0055: The conceptual topic '[title]' (ID: [id]) must either specify a topic file or it must contains sub-topics
docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be005.summary: BE0055: The conceptual topic '[title]' (ID: [id]) must either specify a topic file or it must contains sub-topics Error BE0055: The conceptual topic ' [title] ' (ID: [id]) must either specify a topic file or it must contains sub-topics Cause This error occurs if a conceptual content layout file contains an entry that has to file associated with it and does not have any child nodes. Solution Container nodes are valid in a content layout file but they must have child nodes in order to make them useful. Either remove the indicated node, associate it with a topic, or add child nodes with topics to it so that it is valid. If you are in the process of creating the file, you can add a placeholder topic to make it valid for the build. See Also Concepts Build Engine

docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be005.title: BE0056: The conceptual content file '[file]' with ID '[id]' does not exist
docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be005.summary: BE0056: The conceptual content file '[file]' with ID '[id]' does not exist Error BE0056: The conceptual content file ' [file] ' with ID ' [id] ' does not exist Cause This error occurs if the indicated topic file with the given ID could not be found on disk. Solution Check to be sure that the file exists on disk. See Also Concepts Build Engine

docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be005.title: BE0057: The conceptual content file '[file]' with ID '[id]' is not valid: [error]
docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be005.summary: BE0057: The conceptual content file '[file]' with ID '[id]' is not valid: [error] Error BE0057: The conceptual content file ' [file] ' with ID ' [id] ' is not valid: [error] Cause This error occurs if the given topic file is not valid for some reason (i.e. ill-formed XML, unrecognized entity, etc.). Solution Refer to the error message for information about the cause of the problem. The most likely reason is ill-formed XML. In that case the error message will contain the line number and column of the element that caused the problem. This will help you locate and fix the problem. See Also Concepts Build Engine

docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be005.title: BE0058: Two conceptual content files have the same ID ({0})
docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be005.summary: BE0058: Two conceptual content files have the same ID ({0}) Error BE0058: Two conceptual content files have the same ID ([id]). The file with the duplicate ID is ' [file] ' Cause This error occurs if two conceptual content topics have the same ID. This can happen if you copy and paste a topic to create a new one but forget to give the new file a new unique ID. Solution Each conceptual content topic file must have a unique ID. Locate the topics with the duplicate ID and change one of them by giving it a new unique ID value. Note You should probably search for occurrences of the ID in link elements and check to make sure that the links go to the correct topic. Tip If you need to clone a topic, it is usually best to add a new conceptual content topic so that it gets a unique ID and then copy and paste just the content from the introduction element through the relatedTopics element from the source topic into the new topic. See Also Concepts Build Engine

docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be005.title: BE0059: LCID '[id]' not found in configuration file
docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be005.summary: BE0059: LCID '[id]' not found in configuration file Warning BE0059: LCID ' [id] ' not found in configuration file. Defaulting to ANSI code page value of ' [codePage] '. Cause This warning appears if the specified locale ID cannot be found in the help file builder's SandcastleHtmlExtract.config file. In such cases, the indicated default ANSI code page value and encoding character set are used instead when updating the table of contents file with entries for the additional and conceptual content. Solution This will occur if you select a language for which there is no corresponding language element in the SandcastleHtmlExtract.config file. This file can be found in the help file builder installation folder. You can edit this file to add an element that defines the code page and character set to use for the given locale ID. If you do make an addition, please open an issue at theSHFBproject on GitHub to have the change added to the next release of the help file builder. See Also Concepts Build Engine

docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be006.title: BE0060: The [itemType] '[item]' contains a comma or '.h' which may cause the Help 1 compiler to fail
docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be006.summary: BE0060: The [itemType] '[item]' contains a comma or '.h' which may cause the Help 1 compiler to fail Error BE0060: The [itemType] ' [item] ' contains a comma or '.h' which may cause the Help 1 compiler to fail. Cause This error is issued if the build process detects the text ".h" or a comma within the value of the indicated item while generating the file list for the Help 1 project file. In such cases, the help compiler may generate spurious HHC3002 and HHC3004 errors reporting that the content files are invalid. Solution The HTML Help 1 compiler has problems interpreting paths and filenames that end with something equal to or starting with ".help" or ".hlp" or that contain ".h" in general (i.e. *C:\Project.Help*). Rename the offending folder or filename to remove the period or comma or change the "help" or "hlp" part and try the build again (i.e. *C:\Project_Help*, *C:\ProjectHelp*, or *C:\Project.Docs*). There may also be issues with paths containing commas so you may need to remove them as well if any are present in the path. See Also Concepts Build Engine

docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be006.title: BE0061: File '[file]' could not be loaded and will not be used as an XML comments file
docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be006.summary: BE0061: File '[file]' could not be loaded and will not be used as an XML comments file Warning BE0061: File ' [file] ' could not be loaded and will not be used as an XML comments file. Error: [error] Cause This warning occurs if an XML file is found during the validation of the documentation sources and it could not be loaded for some reason. Solution This is a generic catch-all error that occurs if an XML comments file could not be loaded. Refer to the error message for information on how the problem can be resolved. This is a warning so the build will continue. However, if the indicated file does contain comments, they will not appear in the help file. See Also Concepts Build Engine

docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be006.title: BE0062: No XML comments found. The help file will not contain any member comments
docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be006.summary: BE0062: No XML comments found. The help file will not contain any member comments Warning BE0062: No XML comments files found. The help file will not contain any member comments. Cause This warning occurs if no XML comments files are found when validating the documentation sources. If this occurs, the assemblies will still be documented but the API topics will not contain any member comments. Solution To suppress this warning, specify at least one XML comments file as a documentation source. If you did, verify that you got the name correct and that it exists. If using a solution or project file as the documentation source, verify that the XML comments generation option is enabled in each project. See Also Concepts Build Engine

docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be006.title: BE0063: '[file]' matches a previously copied comments filename
docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be006.summary: BE0063: '[file]' matches a previously copied comments filename Warning BE0008: ' [file] ' matches a previously copied comments filename. The duplicate will be copied to a unique name to preserve the comments it contains. Cause This warning occurs if a duplicate XML comments filename is found while validating the documentation sources. Solution The file will be given a unique GUID-based name for the build. To suppress the warning, give the indicated comments file a unique name in the project in which it is defined. See Also Concepts Build Engine

docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be006.title: BE0064: BUILD CANCELLED BY USER
docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be006.summary: BE0064: BUILD CANCELLED BY USER Error BE0064: BUILD CANCELLED BY USER Cause This is the generic error produced when you cancel a build. Solution N/A. See Also Concepts Build Engine

docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be006.title: BE0065: BUILD FAILED: [error]
docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be006.summary: BE0065: BUILD FAILED: [error] Error BE0065: BUILD FAILED: [error] Cause This is the generic error produced when a build fails for an unexpected reason. Solution Review the build log output just prior to the point of this error and look for other error or warning messages that may have contributed to the problem. If you cannot resolve the problem, please post a message in theSHFBdiscussion forum asking for help along with the details from the build log. See Also Concepts Build Engine

docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be006.title: BE0066: [warning]
docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be006.summary: BE0066: [warning] Warning BE0066: [warning] Cause This is the generic warning produced when a build encounters an unexpected condition. The build will continue but you should review the warning to see if the cause can be resolved. Solution Review the build log output just prior to the point of this warning and look for other warning messages that may have contributed to the problem. If you cannot resolve the problem, please post a message in the SHFBdiscussion forum asking for help along with the details from the build log. See Also Concepts Build Engine

docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be006.title: BE0067: Unable to obtain assembly name from project file
docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be006.summary: BE0067: Unable to obtain assembly name from project file Error BE0067: Unable to obtain assembly name from project file ' [projectFile] ' using Configuration ' [config] ', Platform ' [platform] ' Cause The assembly name was unable to be determined in the specified Visual Studio project file because it does not contain a definition for the indicated configuration and platform value combination. Solution Check the following conditions and correct as indicated: Check the configuration and platform values to make sure that you did not misspell them. If misspelled, correct the spelling either on the command line if doing a command line build or in the project's documentation source entry in the Configuration and Platform property settings. If a Configuration or Platform environment variable is defined (the names are case-insensitive), MSBuild will pick up that value and use it as a default if not defined elsewhere. If not needed, delete the environment variables. If they are needed, override their values by specifying the correct value using MSBuild command line options or the Configuration and Platform properties on the documentation source entry for the project. Check the Visual Studio project to ensure that it contains a configuration and platform definition for the specified values. If not, add them using the configuration manager. If not applicable to the project, use the documentation source entry's Configuration and Platform properties to specify the values to use for this particular project. See Also Concepts Build Engine

docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be006.title: BE0068: Incompatible Visual Studio project file format
docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be006.summary: BE0068: Incompatible Visual Studio project file format Error BE0068: Incompatible Visual Studio project file format. [error] Cause An attempt was made to use a Visual Studio project as a documentation source that has an incompatible format. MSBuild projects in the version 1.0 and 2.0 format cannot be parsed. These must be upgraded to the newer format used by MSBuild 4.0 and later. C++ projects created with Visual Studio 2008 and earlier do not use an MSBuild-based format and cannot be parsed. Future versions of Visual Studio may introduce new MSBuild elements and attributes not recognized by the MSBuild engine used by the help file builder to load project files resulting in this error. Solution As a last resort, add the assembly and XML comments file created by the Visual Studio project to the help file builder project as documentation sources rather than the project file that contains them. Likewise, add any required references from the Visual Studio project to the help file builder project's References project node. If the project is using a newer MSBuild file format, please open an issue in the SHFB project and request support for the new project file format. See Also Concepts Build Engine

docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be006.title: BE0069: The project's RootContentContainer property value '[ID]' must be associated with a topic in your project
docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be006.summary: BE0069: The project's RootContentContainer property value '[ID]' must be associated with a topic in your project Error BE0069: The project's root content container topic (ID= [ID]) must have its Visible property set to False in the content layout file. Cause You specified a root content container topic for MS Help Viewer output but the topic's Visible property is not set to False in the content layout file. Solution When creating MS Help Viewer output, your project's conceptual and API content can be parented to an automatically created root container node associated with a conceptual content topic defined within your project. The given topic must have its Visible property set to False in the content layout file so that it does not appear in the table of contents generated by the help file builder. If your intent is to parent the content to a topic inside of your project, use the content layout file's API insertion point option instead which is intended for that purpose. See Also Concepts Build Engine

docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be007.title: BE0070: Differing framework types were detected in the documentation sources
docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be007.summary: BE0070: Differing framework types were detected in the documentation sources Error BE0070: Differing framework types were detected in the documentation sources (i.e. .NET 5 and .NET Standard 2.x). Due to differences in how the core types are redirected, the different frameworks cannot be mixed within the same documentation project. Cause Visual Studio solutions or projects were included as documentation sources that contained projects for a combination of the full .NET Framework, .NET 5.0, .NET Standard, Silverlight Framework, and/or the .NET Portable Framework. This is not allowed as each uses separate framework assemblies that cannot be mixed as it would cause incorrect reflection information to be produced for the combined sets of classes. Solution If the documentation source solutions and projects use multi-targeting, you can set the target framework to use explicitly by specifying it in the TargetFramework property on each documentation source. If the projects do not share a common target framework, separate the projects by platform into their own help file builder projects. The help file projects can then be built separately to produce two or more help files. If you would prefer to have one help file for all of the assemblies, use the Version Builder Plug-In to include the other help file projects into the primary project. Typically, projects for the full .NET Framework and .NET Standard 2.x can be mixed in the same help file builder project as can projects for .NET 5.0, .NET Standard 1.x, and .NET Core 1.0 through 3.1. All other combinations will usually have to be separated. There may be combinations that have not been discovered yet that are incompatible. These will result in incorrect documentation or an error that causes the MRefBuilder tool to fail. See Also Concepts Build Engine

docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be007.title: BE0071: Unable to locate information for the project framework version 'XXXX'
docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be007.summary: BE0071: Unable to locate information for the project framework version 'XXXX' Error BE0071: Unable to locate information for the project framework version ' XXXX ' or a suitable redirected version on this system. Cause The build engine was unable to locate framework information for the version specified in the project's FrameworkVersion property. An attempt was made to redirect usage to a later version but none were found. Solution This can happen if you select a framework that is not installed on the system. For example, choosing an earlier version of the Silverlight framework. If the earlier version is not found, the build engine will attempt to redirect usage to a later version of the framework if one can be found on the system. If the specified version or a later version cannot be found, you will need to install the selected or later version of the framework specified in the project on the system. The framework assemblies are searched for in the Reference Assemblies folder (%ProgramFiles(x86)\Reference Assemblies\Microsoft\Framework). If you have not installed a version of Visual Studio related to the indicated framework version or the related targeting pack, the reference assemblies may not exist there. The simplest solution is to download and install the appropriate targeting pack or copy the reference assemblies from another system that does have them. If using the Sandcastle Help File Builder NuGet package, it may mean that you need to install one or more of the help file builder Reflection Data Set packages which contain the necessary files. If multiple versions of the platform package exist, install the latest release as it will cover all prior releases as well. Be sure to set the project's Component Path project property to the packages folder if it is not under the help file build project folder. Once installed and the component path is set, you may need to close and reopen the project in order for it to detect the newly installed files. See Also Concepts Build Engine

docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be007.title: BE0072: Project framework version 'XXXX' not found. It has been redirected.
docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be007.summary: BE0072: Project framework version 'XXXX' not found. It has been redirected. Warning BE0072: Project framework version ' XXXX ' not found. It has been redirected and will use ' YYYY ' instead. Cause The build engine was unable to locate framework information for the version specified in the project's FrameworkVersion property. A later version of the framework was found and will be used instead. Solution If you require the earlier version of the framework, it must be installed on the system. See Also Concepts Build Engine

docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be007.title: BE0073: A project with a different or higher framework version was found but that version was not found
docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be007.summary: BE0073: A project with a different or higher framework version was found but that version was not found Error BE0073: A project with a different or higher framework version was found but that version (XXXX) or a suitable redirected version was not found on this system. The build cannot continue. Cause A project documentation source specified a later framework version than the one found in the help file builder project. The build engine was unable to locate framework information for that later version and an attempt was made to redirect usage to a later version but none were found. Solution This can happen if you add a project documentation source that uses a later framework version than the one defined in the help file builder project and it is not installed on the system. For example, the documentation source project specifies Silverlight 5 but the help file builder project specified Silverlight 4. If the later version is not found, the build engine will attempt to redirect usage to a later version of the framework if one can be found on the system. If the specified version or a later version cannot be found, you will need to install the selected or later version of the framework specified in the project on the system. See Also Concepts Build Engine

docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be007.title: BE0074: The selected presentation style (XXX) does not support one or more of the selected help file formats
docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be007.summary: BE0074: The selected presentation style (XXX) does not support one or more of the selected help file formats The selected presentation style (XXXX) does not support one or more of the selected help file formats. Supported formats: YYYY Cause The presentation style selected in the help file builder project's PresentationStyle property does not support one or more of the selected output formats (Help 1, MS Help Viewer, Markdown or Website). Solution In order to be built correctly, the selected presentation style must support all of the selected help file output formats. Certain styles may be written for a specific help file formats or may have been deprecated and have not been updated to support later file formats such as MS Help Viewer. Either unselect the unsupported format(s) or choose a different presentation style that does support the selected format(s). See Also Concepts Build Engine

docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be007.title: BE0075: For MS Help Viewer builds, the HtmlHelpName property cannot contain periods
docs/errorsandwarnings/buildengine/be007.summary: BE0075: For MS Help Viewer builds, the HtmlHelpName property cannot contain periods Error BE0075: For MS Help Viewer builds, the HtmlHelpName property cannot contain periods, ampersands, or pound signs as they are not valid in the help file name. Cause This error occurs if there are periods, ampersands, or pound signs in the HtmlHelpName project property value. Solution The HtmlHelpName value is used as the MS Help Viewer help file name when building an MS Help Viewer file. Periods, ampersands, and pound signs are not valid in MS Help Viewer filenames apart from the period used to separate the filename and the extension and must be removed from the property value. See Also Concepts Build Engine

docs/errorsandwarnings/errorsandwarnings.title: Errors and Warnings
docs/errorsandwarnings/errorsandwarnings.summary: Errors and Warnings The topics in this section contains detailed information about each of the warning and error messages that you may encounter when building a project. Each warning or error contains a code. Use that code to look up the related topic for information about what it means and possible solutions. Select a category below for a list of related errors and warnings: Build Engine Generate Inherited Documentation HTML Extract MSBuild Tasks Plug-Ins Project File See Also Concepts Installation Instructions Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) Links to Resources

docs/errorsandwarnings/htmlextract/htmle.title: HTML Extract
docs/errorsandwarnings/htmlextract/htmle.summary: HTML Extract Select an HTML extract tool error or warning below: SHE0001: LCID '[id]' not found in configuration file SHE0002: Unexpected error: [error] SHE0003: Unexpected error applying command line option SHE0004: The key '[key]' used for '[file]' is already in use See Also Concepts Errors and Warnings

docs/errorsandwarnings/htmlextract/she00.title: SHE0001: LCID '[id]' not found in configuration file
docs/errorsandwarnings/htmlextract/she00.summary: SHE0001: LCID '[id]' not found in configuration file Warning SHE0001: LCID ' [id] ' not found in configuration file. Defaulting to ANSI code page value of ' [codePage] ', encoding charset ' [charset] '. Cause This warning appears if the specified locale ID cannot be found in the help file builder's SandcastleHtmlExtract.config file. In such cases, the indicated default ANSI code page value and encoding character set are used instead. Solution This will occur if you select a language for which there is no corresponding language element in the SandcastleHtmlExtract.config file. This file can be found in the help file builder installation folder. You can edit this file to add an element that defines the code page and character set to use for the given locale ID. If you do make an addition, please open an issue at theSHFBproject on GitHub to have the change added to the next release of the help file builder. See Also Concepts HTML Extract

docs/errorsandwarnings/htmlextract/she00.title: SHE0002: Unexpected error: [error]
docs/errorsandwarnings/htmlextract/she00.summary: SHE0002: Unexpected error: [error] Error SHE0002: Unexpected error: [error] Cause This is a generic catch-all error that occurs if a problem is encountered while trying to extract information from the HTML files or produce the output files. Solution Since this is a catch-all error, refer to the error description for information about the cause of the error and how you might be able to correct it (i.e. file not found, permission issues, a corrupt file, etc.). If you are unable to solve the problem based on the reported error, open a work item in the SHFBproject on GitHub containing the details from the error message. Attach the affected project as an example. See Also Concepts HTML Extract

docs/errorsandwarnings/htmlextract/she00.title: SHE0003: Unexpected error applying command line option
docs/errorsandwarnings/htmlextract/she00.summary: SHE0003: Unexpected error applying command line option Error SHE0003: Unexpected error applying command line option ' [option] ': [error] Cause This is a generic catch-all error that occurs if a problem is encountered while trying to parse the value of a command line option. Solution Since this is a catch-all error, refer to the error description for information about the cause of the error and how you might be able to correct it (i.e. bad option value, invalid format, etc.). If you are unable to solve the problem based on the reported error, open an issue in theSHFBproject on GitHub containing the details from the error message. Attach the affected project as an example. See Also Concepts HTML Extract

docs/errorsandwarnings/htmlextract/she00.title: SHE0004: The key '[key]' used for '[file]' is already in use
docs/errorsandwarnings/htmlextract/she00.summary: SHE0004: The key '[key]' used for '[file]' is already in use Warning SHE0004: The key ' [key] ' used for ' [file] ' is already in use by ' [otherFile] '. ' [file] ' will be ignored. Cause This warning occurs if a duplicate topic filename is encountered while parsing files for titles and keywords. This can occur if HTML files are added to a project as additional content. If an identically named file occurs in two separate folders, only the first file will be included in the table of contents. Solution To correct the problem, give the duplicate file a unique name in the project. If the file is referenced in a site map file, edit the site map file to use the new name as well. See Also Concepts HTML Extract

docs/errorsandwarnings/inheriteddocs/gid.title: GID0001: Unexpected error while generating inherited documentation
docs/errorsandwarnings/inheriteddocs/gid.summary: GID0001: Unexpected error while generating inherited documentation Error GID0001: Unexpected error while generating inherited documentation: [error] Cause This is a generic catch-all error that occurs if a problem is encountered while generating the inherited documentation comments. Solution Since this is a catch-all error, refer to the error description for information about the cause of the error and how you might be able to correct it (i.e. file not found, permission issues, a corrupt file, etc.). If you are unable to solve the problem based on the reported error, open a work item in the SHFBproject on GitHub containing the details from the error message. Attach the affected project as an example. See Also Concepts Generate Inherited Documentation

docs/errorsandwarnings/inheriteddocs/gid.title: GID0002: No comments found for cref '[cref]' on member '[id]
docs/errorsandwarnings/inheriteddocs/gid.summary: GID0002: No comments found for cref '[cref]' on member '[id] Warning GID0002: No comments found for cref ' [cref] ' on member ' [id] ' Cause This warning will appear of an <inheritdoc /> element specified a cref attribute but the resulting XPath query resulted in no matches. Solution Check the cref attribute to be sure that it is correct. In addition, check the comments files to be sure that it contains the elements that are to be selected by the XPath query. See Also Concepts Generate Inherited Documentation

docs/errorsandwarnings/inheriteddocs/gid.title: GID0003: Unable to locate API ID '[id]'
docs/errorsandwarnings/inheriteddocs/gid.summary: GID0003: Unable to locate API ID '[id]' Warning GID0003: Unable to locate API ID ' [id] ' Cause This warning occurs if the member ID for an element on which an <inheritdoc /> tag appears cannot be found in the reflection information file. Solution The possible causes for this warning are as follows: The indicated ID name is misspelled or does not exist. In this, case, you must correct the ID so that it refers to a valid member ID. The indicated member is private or internal and the build is only documenting the public API members. If you want the member included in the help file, you must enable documentation of the private and/or internal members using the DocumentInternals and/or DocumentPrivates project properties. In general, you can ignore these warnings as the members will not appear in the help file anyway. The member has been excluded via an <exclude /> tag or the ApiFilter project property or the namespace has been excluded via the NamespaceSummaries property. If you want the member included, you must remove the <exclude /> tag or enable it in the API filter or namespace summaries. In general, you can ignore these warnings as the members will not appear in the help file anyway. See Also Concepts Generate Inherited Documentation

docs/errorsandwarnings/inheriteddocs/gid.title: GID0004: No comments found for member '[id]'
docs/errorsandwarnings/inheriteddocs/gid.summary: GID0004: No comments found for member '[id]' Warning GID0004: No comments found for member ' [id] ' Cause No inheritable comments were found for the indicated member ID. Solution The possible causes for this warning are as follows: The indicated ID name is misspelled or does not exist. In this, case, you must correct the ID so that it refers to a valid member ID. The member does not represent an item from which comments can be inherited (i.e. not a class, an interface member, a virtual member, etc.). The member's base elements do not contain comments. In this case, you must add comments on the base members so that they can be inherited. If you specified a cref and/or a select attribute check them to make sure that they are accurate and will result in member comments that can be inherited. See Also Concepts Generate Inherited Documentation

docs/errorsandwarnings/inheriteddocs/gid.title: GID0005: No comments found for cref '[cref]'
docs/errorsandwarnings/inheriteddocs/gid.summary: GID0005: No comments found for cref '[cref]' Warning GID0005: No comments found for cref ' [cref] ' on member ' [memberId] ' in ' [nestedElement] ' Cause No inheritable comments were found for the indicated cref value in the nested comment element of the indicated member ID. Solution The possible causes for this warning are as follows: The indicated ID name is misspelled or does not exist. In this, case, you must correct the ID so that it refers to a valid member ID. The member does not represent an item from which comments can be inherited (i.e. not a class, an interface member, a virtual member, etc.). The member's base elements do not contain comments. In this case, you must add comments on the base members so that they can be inherited. If you specified a cref and/or a select attribute check them to make sure that they are accurate and will result in member comments that can be inherited. See Also Concepts Generate Inherited Documentation

docs/errorsandwarnings/inheriteddocs/gid.title: GID0006: No comments found for member '[memberId]'
docs/errorsandwarnings/inheriteddocs/gid.summary: GID0006: No comments found for member '[memberId]' Warning GID0006: No comments found for member ' [memberId] ' in ' [nestedElement] ' Cause No inheritable comments were found for the nested comment element of the indicated member ID. Solution The possible causes for this warning are as follows: The indicated ID name is misspelled or does not exist. In this, case, you must correct the ID so that it refers to a valid member ID. The member does not represent an item from which comments can be inherited (i.e. not a class, an interface member, a virtual member, etc.). The member's base elements do not contain comments. In this case, you must add comments on the base members so that they can be inherited. If you specified a cref and/or a select attribute check them to make sure that they are accurate and will result in member comments that can be inherited. If the [nestedElement] part of the message is "[Base member from reference assembly not included for documentation]", it means that the identified member tried to inherit documentation from a base class that is in a reference assembly. You can resolve this problem by using the Additional Reference Links plug-in to add reference information for the assembly. Be sure to include the reference assembly's XML comments file in the main project so that the inherited documentation can be found. See Also Concepts Generate Inherited Documentation

docs/errorsandwarnings/inheriteddocs/gid.title: GID0007: Ignoring non-XML comments file
docs/errorsandwarnings/inheriteddocs/gid.summary: GID0007: Ignoring non-XML comments file Warning GID0007: Ignoring non-XML comments file Cause This warning occurs if a filename is encountered while indexing comments files that does not have a .xml extension. Solution If the file is not an XML comments file, the warning can be ignored. If it is intended to be a n XML comments file, rename it to use a .xml extension. See Also Concepts Generate Inherited Documentation

docs/errorsandwarnings/inheriteddocs/gid.title: GID0008: Entries for the key '[id]' occur in both '[file1]' and '[file2]'
docs/errorsandwarnings/inheriteddocs/gid.summary: GID0008: Entries for the key '[id]' occur in both '[file1]' and '[file2]' Warning GID0008: Entries for the key ' [id] ' occur in both ' [file1] ' and ' [file2] '. The entries in ' [file2] ' will be used. Cause This warning occurs if a member ID occurs in more than one comments file. In such cases, the ID and its related comments from the second file will be used rather than those in the first file. Solution This warning can usually be safely ignored as it simply means that a subsequent comments file is overriding the comments for the given ID with an alternate set of comments. This can happen frequently in the base .NET Framework classes. If the second set of comments used are not appropriate, you may need to take steps to rearrange the files, remove the duplicate set of comments, or supply an additional file that further overrides the comments. See Also Concepts Generate Inherited Documentation

docs/errorsandwarnings/inheriteddocs/gid.title: GID0009: Circular reference detected: [member ID stack]
docs/errorsandwarnings/inheriteddocs/gid.summary: GID0009: Circular reference detected: [member ID stack] Warning GID0009: Circular reference detected: ' [member ID stack] ' Cause This warning occurs if a set of member comments attempts to inherit documentation from itself or a set of parent member comments that have already been encountered thus creating a loop. If this occurs, no further attempt will be made to process inherited comments which may result in incorrect documentation. Solution Typically, this is a problem but it may be legitimate if an element inherits comments from another element within the same member comments (i.e. inheriting a span or paragraph from the summary in the remarks element). Review the member ID stack that resulted in the warning. If the circular reference is valid, the warning can be ignored. If the circular reference is not valid, correct the comments to remove the circular reference. See Also Concepts Generate Inherited Documentation

docs/errorsandwarnings/inheriteddocs/gid.title: GID0010: '[member ID]' uses the deprecated inheritdoc 'select' attribute
docs/errorsandwarnings/inheriteddocs/gid.summary: GID0010: '[member ID]' uses the deprecated inheritdoc 'select' attribute Warning GID0010: '[member id]' uses the deprecated inheritdoc 'select' attribute. Use the equivalent 'path' attribute instead. Cause This warning occurs if the deprecated select attribute is seen on the inheritdoc element. Solution Replace the deprecated select attribute with the path attribute so that it is consistent with the XML comments IntelliSense usage in Visual Studio 2019 version 16.4 and later. See Also Concepts Generate Inherited Documentation

docs/errorsandwarnings/inheriteddocs/inh.title: Generate Inherited Documentation
docs/errorsandwarnings/inheriteddocs/inh.summary: Generate Inherited Documentation Select an inherited documentation tool error or warning below: GID0001: Unexpected error while generating inherited documentation GID0002: No comments found for cref '[cref]' on member '[id] GID0003: Unable to locate API ID '[id]' GID0004: No comments found for member '[id]' GID0005: No comments found for cref '[cref]' GID0006: No comments found for member '[memberId]' GID0007: Ignoring non-XML comments file GID0008: Entries for the key '[id]' occur in both '[file1]' and '[file2]' GID0009: Circular reference detected: [member ID stack] GID0010: '[member ID]' uses the deprecated inheritdoc 'select' attribute See Also Concepts Errors and Warnings

docs/errorsandwarnings/msbuildtasks/b1x0.title: B1X0001: A help compiler path must be specified
docs/errorsandwarnings/msbuildtasks/b1x0.summary: B1X0001: A help compiler path must be specified Error B1X0001: A help compiler path must be specified Cause This error occurs if the HelpCompilerFolder property on the Build1xHelpFile build task has not been set or is set to an empty string. Solution Specify a valid path for the HelpCompilerFolder property on the Build1xHelpFile build task in the project file. See Also Concepts MSBuild Tasks

docs/errorsandwarnings/msbuildtasks/b1x0.title: B1X0002: A help project file must be specified and it must exist
docs/errorsandwarnings/msbuildtasks/b1x0.summary: B1X0002: A help project file must be specified and it must exist Error B1X0002: A help project file must be specified and it must exist Cause This error occurs if the HelpProjectName property on the Build1xHelpFile build task has not been set, is set to an empty string, or refers to a file that does not exist. Solution Specify a valid file that exists for the HelpProjectName property on the Build1xHelpFile build task in the project file. See Also Concepts MSBuild Tasks

docs/errorsandwarnings/msbuildtasks/b2x0.title: B2X0001: A help compiler path must be specified
docs/errorsandwarnings/msbuildtasks/b2x0.summary: B2X0001: A help compiler path must be specified Error B2X0001: A help compiler path must be specified Cause This error occurs if the HelpCompilerFolder property on the Build2xHelpFile build task has not been set or is set to an empty string. Solution Specify a valid path for the HelpCompilerFolder property on the Build2xHelpFile build task in the project file. See Also Concepts MSBuild Tasks

docs/errorsandwarnings/msbuildtasks/b2x0.title: B2X0002: An HTML help base name must be specified
docs/errorsandwarnings/msbuildtasks/b2x0.summary: B2X0002: An HTML help base name must be specified Error B2X0002: An HTML help base name must be specified Cause This error occurs if the HtmlHelpName property on the Build2xHelpFile build task has not been set or is set to an empty string. Solution Specify a valid name for the HtmlHelpName property on the Build2xHelpFile build task in the project file. Note The project file that is to be compiled must also be named using the HtmlHelpName value with a .HxS extension. The project file must exist in the folder specified in the WorkingFolder property. See Also Concepts MSBuild Tasks

docs/errorsandwarnings/msbuildtasks/bht0.title: BHT0001: Unable to get executing project
docs/errorsandwarnings/msbuildtasks/bht0.summary: BHT0001: Unable to get executing project Warning BHT0001: Unable to get executing project: [reason]. The specified project will be loaded but command line property overrides will be ignored. Cause The BuildHelp build task was unable to obtain a reference to the executing project for the reason indicated. Solution This most likely indicates an internal error in the build process. Open an issue in the SHFBproject on GitHub containing the details from the error message and attach a small example project with any related files that can be used to duplicate the problem. See Also Concepts MSBuild Tasks

docs/errorsandwarnings/msbuildtasks/bht0.title: BHT0002: Unable to build project '[projectFile]': [error]
docs/errorsandwarnings/msbuildtasks/bht0.summary: BHT0002: Unable to build project '[projectFile]': [error] Error BHT0002: Unable to build project ' [projectFile] ': [error] Cause This is a generic catch-all error that occurs when a build fails unexpectedly. Solution Review the build log output and look for other error or warning messages that may have contributed to the problem. If you cannot resolve the problem, please post a message in the SHFBdiscussion forum asking for help along with the details from the build log. See Also Concepts MSBuild Tasks

docs/errorsandwarnings/msbuildtasks/bht0.title: BHT0003: The specified project file does not exist: [projectFile]
docs/errorsandwarnings/msbuildtasks/bht0.summary: BHT0003: The specified project file does not exist: [projectFile] Error BHT0003: The specified project file does not exist: [projectFile] Cause This error occurs if the project file referenced by the ProjectFile property on the BuildHelp build task could not be found. Solution Check the value of the property to ensure that the filename is correct and that the project file does exist. See Also Concepts MSBuild Tasks

docs/errorsandwarnings/msbuildtasks/bht0.title: BHT0004: Multiple matching projects were found
docs/errorsandwarnings/msbuildtasks/bht0.summary: BHT0004: Multiple matching projects were found Warning BHT0004: Multiple matching projects were found. Only the first one found will be built. Cause The BuildHelp build task found more than one copy of the project file in the MSBuild global project collection. Solution This error is unlikely to occur as MSBuild.exe does not currently appear to use the global project collection when invoked from the command line. If you encounter this error, please open a work item in the SHFBproject on GitHub containing the details of the build and attach a small example project with any related files that can be used to duplicate the problem. See Also Concepts MSBuild Tasks

docs/errorsandwarnings/msbuildtasks/ct00.title: CT0001: Unable to clean output folder. Reason: [reason]
docs/errorsandwarnings/msbuildtasks/ct00.summary: CT0001: Unable to clean output folder. Reason: [reason] Error CT0001: Unable to clean output folder. Reason: [reason] Cause This error occurs if the CleanHelp build task is unable to purge the folders specified in the WorkingPath and OutputPath properties. Solution This is a generic, catch-all error that occurs if the specified folders could not be purged. Refer to the additional error information for information about why the error occurred and how it can be fixed (i.e. the folder is in use, no permission, etc.). See Also Concepts MSBuild Tasks

docs/errorsandwarnings/msbuildtasks/msbu.title: MSBuild Tasks
docs/errorsandwarnings/msbuildtasks/msbu.summary: MSBuild Tasks Select a build task error or warning below: B1X0001: A help compiler path must be specified B1X0002: A help project file must be specified and it must exist B2X0001: A help compiler path must be specified B2X0002: An HTML help base name must be specified BHT0001: Unable to get executing project BHT0002: Unable to build project '[projectFile]': [error] BHT0003: The specified project file does not exist: [projectFile] BHT0004: Multiple matching projects were found CT0001: Unable to clean output folder. Reason: [reason] See Also Concepts Errors and Warnings

docs/errorsandwarnings/plugins/acp0001.h.title: ACP0001: The Additional Content Only plug-in requires...
docs/errorsandwarnings/plugins/acp0001.h.summary: ACP0001: The Additional Content Only plug-in requires... Error ACP0001: The Additional Content Only plug-in requires a conceptual content layout file, a site map file, or content items in the project Cause This error occurs if the Additional Content Only plug-in cannot find at least one content layout file, site map file, or a file item with a build action of Content. Solution In order to produce a help file containing no API content, there must be at least one content layout file, a site map file, or some HTML content file items that can be used to produce non-API help topics that will appear in the help file. Add at least one required item and any additional files and perform the build again. See Also Concepts Plug-Ins

docs/errorsandwarnings/plugins/adp0001.h.title: ADP0001: Placeholder
docs/errorsandwarnings/plugins/adp0001.h.summary: ADP0001: Placeholder TODO: Error message goes here Cause TODO: Describe the cause Solution TODO: Describe possible solution See Also Concepts Plug-Ins

docs/errorsandwarnings/plugins/arl0001.h.title: ARL0001: The Additional Reference Links plug-in has not been configured yet
docs/errorsandwarnings/plugins/arl0001.h.summary: ARL0001: The Additional Reference Links plug-in has not been configured yet Error ARL0001: The Additional Reference Links plug-in has not been configured yet Cause The plug-in was added to the project but was not configured. The default configuration is not sufficient to use it in a build. Solution Open the editor for the PlugInConfigurations project property, select the plug-in, and click the Configure button to specify a valid configuration for it. See Also Concepts Plug-Ins

docs/errorsandwarnings/plugins/arl0002.h.title: ARL0002: At least one target is required for the Additional Reference Links plug-in
docs/errorsandwarnings/plugins/arl0002.h.summary: ARL0002: At least one target is required for the Additional Reference Links plug-in Error ARL0002: At least one target is required for the Additional Reference Links plug-in Cause The plug-in was added to the project but was not configured correctly. Solution Open the editor for the PlugInConfigurations project property, select the plug-in, and click the Configure button to specify a valid configuration for it. Add at least one project file to use as a source of additional reference links. See Also Concepts Plug-Ins

docs/errorsandwarnings/plugins/arl0003.h.title: ARL0003: Unable to build additional target project: [projectFile]
docs/errorsandwarnings/plugins/arl0003.h.summary: ARL0003: Unable to build additional target project: [projectFile] Error ARL0003: Unable to build additional target project: [projectFile] Cause This error occurs if there was a problem building the specified project file in order to obtain reference link information. Solution This is a generic, catch-all error. Load the indicated project and build it by itself to see if you can locate the cause of the problem. If it works by itself, look in the .\Working folder under the build folder of the project that uses it in the plug-in. You will find a build subfolder for it containing a log file. Review it to see if it can help you locate the cause of the error. If you are unable to resolve the issue, open an issue in the SHFBproject on GitHub containing the details from the error message and attach a small example project with any related files that can be used to duplicate the problem. See Also Concepts Plug-Ins

docs/errorsandwarnings/plugins/arl0004.h.title: ARL0004: Unable to locate Reflection Index Data component in [configFile]
docs/errorsandwarnings/plugins/arl0004.h.summary: ARL0004: Unable to locate Reflection Index Data component in [configFile] Error ARL0004: Unable to locate Reflection Index Data component in [configFile] Cause The Reflection Index Data component could not be located in the indicated configuration file. Solution This most likely indicates an internal error in the plug-in. Open an issue in the SHFBproject on GitHub containing the details from the error message and attach a small example project with any related files that can be used to duplicate the problem. See Also Concepts Plug-Ins

docs/errorsandwarnings/plugins/arl0005.h.summary: ARL0005: Unable to locate Resolve Reference Links component in [configFile] Error ARL0005: Unable to locate Resolve Reference Links component in [configFile] Cause The Resolve Reference Links component could not be located in the indicated configuration file. Solution This is a generic, catch-all error. Load the indicated project and build it by itself to see if you can locate the cause of the problem. If it works by itself, look in the .\Working folder under the build folder of the project that uses it in the plug-in. You will find a build subfolder for it containing a log file. Review it to see if it can help you locate the cause of the error. If you are unable to resolve the issue, open an issue in the SHFBproject on GitHub containing the details from the error message and attach a small example project with any related files that can be used to duplicate the problem. docs/errorsandwarnings/plugins/arl0007.h.title: ARL0007: The help file project cannot be blank
docs/errorsandwarnings/plugins/arl0007.h.summary: ARL0007: The help file project cannot be blank Error ARL0007: The help file project cannot be blank Cause This error occurs if the Additional Reference Links plug-in has an invalid configuration. Solution Open the editor for the PlugInConfigurations project property, select the plug-in, and click the Configure button to specify a valid configuration for it. Be sure that the project filenames in each entry are not blank. See Also Concepts Plug-Ins

docs/errorsandwarnings/projectfile/prj00.title: PRJ0001: Invalid or missing SchemaVersion
docs/errorsandwarnings/projectfile/prj00.summary: PRJ0001: Invalid or missing SchemaVersion Error PRJ0001: Invalid or missing SHFBSchemaVersion Cause This error is caused by a missing schema version property in the project. Solution The most likely cause of this error is that you have attempted to load a project file that is not valid for use with the current release of the help file builder. Only projects using the newer MSBuild format can be loaded with version 1.8.0.0 and later. Recreate the project with the current help file builder release. Another cause is loading an MSBuild project file that was not created by the help file builder. Depending on what the project file is for, you may be able to convert it to the help file builder format too. See Also Concepts Project File

docs/errorsandwarnings/projectfile/prj00.title: PRJ0002: The selected file is for a more recent version
docs/errorsandwarnings/projectfile/prj00.summary: PRJ0002: The selected file is for a more recent version Error PRJ0002: The selected file is for a more recent version of the help file builder. Please upgrade your copy to load the file. Cause As indicated, the selected project file is for a more recent version of the help file builder. It contains project options that cannot be handled by your current release. Solution Upgrade to the latest release of Sandcastle and the SHFB. See Also Concepts Project File

docs/errorsandwarnings/projectfile/prj00.title: PRJ0003: Error reading project from '[file]': [reason]
docs/errorsandwarnings/projectfile/prj00.summary: PRJ0003: Error reading project from '[file]': [reason] Error PRJ0003: Error reading project from ' [file] ': [reason] Cause This is a generic catch-all error that occurs when there is a problem attempting to load a help file builder project. If you have been modifying the project file by hand, it could indicate that you have introduced an error into the help file properties. Solution Since this is a catch-all error, refer to the reason description for information about the cause of the error and how you might be able to correct it (i.e. file not found, permission issues, a corrupt file, etc.). If you have been modifying the help file project by hand rather than by using the help file builder standalone GUI, back out your changes and try to reload the project. If you have not made any such modifications, open an issue in the SHFBproject on GitHub containing the details from the error message. Attach the affected project as an example. See Also Concepts Project File

docs/errorsandwarnings/projectfile/prj00.title: PRJ0004: An attempt was made to set a read-only or ignored property
docs/errorsandwarnings/projectfile/prj00.summary: PRJ0004: An attempt was made to set a read-only or ignored property Error PRJ0004: An attempt was made to set a read-only or ignored property: [property] Value: [value] Cause This is an internal error that indicates a problem with the project system or the project file. If you have been modifying the project file by hand, it could indicate that you have introduced an error into the help file properties. Solution If you have been modifying the help file project by hand rather than by using the help file builder standalone GUI, back out your changes and try to reload the project. If you have not made any such modifications, open an issue in the SHFBproject on GitHub containing the details from the error message. Attach the affected project as an example. See Also Concepts Project File

docs/errorsandwarnings/projectfile/prj00.title: PRJ0005: Unable to parse value '[value]' for property '[property]'
docs/errorsandwarnings/projectfile/prj00.summary: PRJ0005: Unable to parse value '[value]' for property '[property]' Error PRJ0005: Unable to parse value ' [value] ' for property ' [property] ' Cause This is an internal error that indicates a problem with the project system or the project file. If you have been modifying the project file by hand, it could indicate that you have introduced an error into the help file properties. Solution If you have been modifying the help file project by hand rather than by using the help file builder standalone GUI, back out your changes and try to reload the project. If you have not made any such modifications, open an issue in the SHFBproject on GitHub containing the details from the error message. Attach the affected project as an example. See Also Concepts Project File

docs/errorsandwarnings/projectfile/prj00.title: PRJ0006: Error saving project to '[file]': [reason]
docs/errorsandwarnings/projectfile/prj00.summary: PRJ0006: Error saving project to '[file]': [reason] Error PRJ0006: Error saving project to ' [file] ': [reason] Cause This is a generic catch-all error that occurs when a problem occurs while attempting to save a help file builder project. If you have been modifying the project file by hand, it could indicate that you have introduced an error into the help file properties. Solution Since this is a catch-all error, refer to the reason description for information about the cause of the error and how you might be able to correct it (i.e. permission issues, out of disk space, etc.). If you have been modifying the help file project by hand rather than by using the help file builder standalone GUI, back out your changes and try to reload the project, make any necessary changes, and save the project. If you have not made any such modifications, open an issue in theSHFBproject on GitHub containing the details from the error message. Attach the affected project as an example. See Also Concepts Project File

docs/faq/apifilterissues.html.title: API Filter Issues
docs/faq/apifilterissues.html.summary: API Filter Issues This topic covers common questions and issues related to the API Filter. I used the Namespace Summaries project option to exclude a namespace but it is still showing up inthe help file. Why? Check the build log in the section where it generated the API filter. You will probably see a warning there about the exclusion conflicting with the API filter. The API filter always wins. To fix the issue, edit the API Filter project property and exclude the item there. I used the <exclude /> tag feature to exclude a namespace/type/member but it is still showingup in the help file. Why? See the answer to the previous question. I used the Namespace Summaries project option to exclude a namespace. I now want it included but itis not showing up. Why? Check the API Filter project property as it is probably being excluded in there. This situation does not generate a warning in the log so you have to check for it manually. Simply place a checkmark next to the item you want to have included. I used the <exclude /> tag to exclude a namespace/type/member. I removed the tag as I nowwant it included but it is not showing up. Why? See the answer to the previous question. Why does the API filter uncheck/check the parent namespace/type if I uncheck/check more than half ofthe types/members? This behavior is by design. See the Including and Excluding Members section of the API Filter Property help topic. It is done to create a more efficient filter. If more than half of the members are omitted, the parent is written out as an exclude entry with child entries just for those marked for inclusion. If more than half are included, the opposite occurs. Building the help file will result in the proper members being included or excluded. If you think you are seeing incorrect behavior with regard to the resulting help file, please supply an example that demonstrates the problem. See Also Concepts Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)

docs/faq/buildcomponents.html.title: Build Components
docs/faq/buildcomponents.html.summary: Build Components This topic covers common questions and issues related to build components. How do I configure the custom build components with project-specific settings? Use the Components project property category. Select the component from the list on the property page, add it to the project, and click the Configure button. Where can I find more information on the custom build components supplied with the help file builder? See the BuildAssembler Components help topic for more information and links to details about each component. How can I create my own custom build components? For information on writing your own custom build components, see the Creating a BuildAssembler Build Component topic. See Also Concepts Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)

docs/faq/buildfailures.html.title: Build Failures
docs/faq/buildfailures.html.summary: Build Failures This topic covers common questions and issues related to general build failures. Tip Most build failures contain an error number such as BE0065. See the Errors and Warnings topic to locate the error or warning number for more details about its cause and possible solutions. Why does the build fail telling me that it cannot find the Sandcastle or help compiler tools? First and foremost, be sure that you have installed the latest version of the help file builder and any required help compiler(s). The help compilers are not part of the help file builder and must be downloaded and installed separately. See the Installation Instructions topic for information on where to download the required tools. If you have the tools installed, but in a non-standard location, you may need to specify the paths to the tools. See the Paths Category Properties topic for more information. Why does my build fail with an error saying that it cannot find an assembly? When you added documentation sources to the project, you may have specified the wrong name or perhaps chose the assembly from the wrong folder (i.e. .\Debug instead of .\Release). Check the assembly path and filename and verify that it does exist. If the path is correct, make sure the assembly actually exists. Rebuild your project if necessary to recreate it. If using a solution or project as the documentation source, be sure that the configuration and platform settings are correct and that the assemblies exist for the given combination of configuration and platform. Check both the global settings and, if necessary the documentation source settings to find out what configuration and platform are expected. The build log may also indicate which configuration and platform where found and used. Why does my build fail with an "Unresolved assembly reference" error? If the build fails in the Generating reflection information step with an error that starts " Error: Unresolved assembly reference ", you need to add the named assembly as a reference. This is done by adding a reference to it in the References node in the Project Explorer window. See the References topic for more information on adding reference items. Another common cause of this error is not setting the project's Framework Version property correctly. For example, you may have left it set to .NET Framework 4.5 but you are actually documenting a .NET Portable or Silverlight framework assembly. You can typically tell if this is the case as the version number in the error message will not match the framework version in the project. Correcting the project framework version should resolve the issue. Using a Visual Studio solution or project as the documentation source is recommended as the help file builder will figure out the framework version and references automatically based on the project settings. In some cases, the documented assembly may reference an assembly with a version that is different than the one you have or may reference an assembly that you do not have. In such cases the Assembly Binding Redirection Plug-In can be added to the project to resolve these issues. See the referenced topic for more information. Why can't Sandcastle resolve all dependent assembly references automatically? Sandcastle, specifically MRefBuilder, uses CCI (Common Compiler Infrastructure) for assembly reflection. CCI searches the current directory for dependent assemblies as well as any directories specified by the /dep (Dependencies) command line option. CCI does not attempt to open a dependent assembly until some information from that assembly is needed. CCI is used because technically, CCI never "loads" any assembly; it just parses the data in the assembly file. That is why CCI can reflect over a foreign mscorlib while System.Reflection cannot. This allows Sandcastle to be used for documenting assemblies built with any version of the .NET Framework. CCI is also used by FxCop. After building a help file, I cannot rebuild the projects for the documented assemblies due to anerror that says they are already in use by another process. Why? The build engine searches the project folder and all subfolders as well as the project's Component Path property folder if specified for Managed Extensibility Framework (MEF) components that can be used for build components, plug-ins, syntax generators, and presentation styles. Unfortunately, MEF does not unload assemblies that it does not need. If your documented assemblies are in a subfolder below where the help file builder project is stored or the specified Component Path location, they will be loaded during the component search and will not be released until you close Visual Studio or the standalone GUI. The solution is simple. Move the help file builder project to its own sub-folder so that it does not get to search the folders containing the assemblies being documented. If using the Component Path property to specify a location to search for components, place them in a sub-folder or another location so that it will not find the documented assemblies as well. Why does my build fail with an error saying "No APIs found to document"? Classes need to be declared public in your code, you need to enable the Document Privates and/or Document Internals project property so that Sandcastle documents the internal/private members, or you need to include at least one assembly and at least one namespace to document. There should be at least one assembly, solution, or project file listed in the Documentation Sources node in the Project Explorer window. Use the Namespaces Summaries or API Filter project property editor to be sure that you have at least one valid item that is checked and thus included. If you are using the API Filter property, check it to make sure you have not accidentally excluded everything. Why does my build fail in MRefBuilder with a NullReferenceException related to OrcasNamer.WriteType? The most likely cause of this problem is that you have the project's Framework Version property set to .NET 1.0 or .NET 1.1 but you are trying to document a .NET 2.0 or later assembly. Check the property to make sure that it is set appropriately for your assembly. I'm getting an Out of Memory exception during a very large build. How do I prevent it? When performing a build that generates an extremely large amount of output, you may encounter an OutOfMemoryException if verbose logging is enabled in the help file builder GUI. If this occurs, turn off the Build window verbose logging enabled option in the user preferences. Full details are still written to the log file and can be viewed after the build. If the error persists, you may be trying to document too many assemblies or one that contains an extremely large number of namespaces and/or types. The only solution in this case is to break up the project so that it documents fewer namespaces and/or types thus reducing the amount of memory required. If you are building the help on a 32-bit system, switching to a 64-bit system with more memory may allow the build to complete. If the Help 1 compiler fails due to an out of memory condition, it is doubtful that there is much that can be done. Since its a 32-bit process, the Help 1 compiler wont use more memory than the maximum addressable by a 32-bit process (somewhere between 2GB and 4GB depending on various factors). Switching to an alternate output format such as MS Help Viewer or breaking the project up into smaller parts are probably the only solutions for it. I want to create a help file without an assembly. When I try to build the help file, it fails andtells me I need at least one documentation source. Why? Sandcastle was designed to document code based on a set of XML comments and API information found in a reflection information file. As such, it requires at least one assembly in order to produce a help file containing API documentation. If you do not include at least one assembly with a namespace containing at least one public class, the help file cannot be produced. However, you can use the Additional Content Only Plug-In to produce a help file based on conceptual content alone. To do so, add the plug-in to the project via the Plug-Ins project property category, add conceptual content to the project, and build the help file. See the Conceptual Content topic for more information about how to utilize conceptual content. See Also Concepts Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)

docs/faq/conceptualadditionalcontent.htm.title: Conceptual Content/Additional Content
docs/faq/conceptualadditionalcontent.htm.summary: Conceptual Content/Additional Content This topic covers common questions and issues related to the conceptual content and additional content. I want my additional content (HTML) pages to look like the selected presentation style used in theAPI topics. How can I do that? The preferred method for adding additional content (also known as conceptual content) to a project is to use Microsoft Assistance Markup Language (MAML). To have the HTML topics match the presentation style, convert them to MAML. See the Conceptual and Additional Content topics for more information. How do I arrange the conceptual content pages and specify which is the default topic? The content layout file editor is used to define the content layout and the default topic. See Also Concepts Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)

docs/faq/documentingassemblies.html.title: Documenting Assemblies
docs/faq/documentingassemblies.html.summary: Documenting Assemblies This topic covers common questions and issues related to documenting assemblies. How do I add a logo to the header in my help file topics? To add a logo to the topic headers, do the following: In the Solution Explorer tool window (Project Explorer in the standalone GUI), right click on the help file builder project node and select the option to add a new folder to the root of the project. Name the folder "icons". The name must be in lowercase. Right click on the new *icons* folder and select the option to add a new image file or select the option to add an existing file and select the image you want to use. Right click on the image file that you added to the project and select the Properties option to view the file properties. In the file properties tool window, change the Build Action property to "Content". This ensures that the logo file is included in the help content and it will be placed in the *icons* folder in the help content. Right click on the project node again and select Properties to open the help file builder project properties. Select the Transform Args category. Locate the logoFile transform argument property in the list. If one does not appear, your selected presentation style or the help file format does not support it. If it does and the property appears, enter the filename as the property value. Enter the filename alone omitting all path information (i.e. HelpLogo.jpg rather than icons\HelpLogo.jpg). If building website output and your web server is case-sensitive, be sure to match the case of the folder name in your project with that of the presentation style. The same applies to the logo filename itself. Set the other logo transform arguments such as the placement, alignment, and dimensions as needed. After performing the steps above, you should see the logo in the topics after rebuilding your help file. When I build my project, the BuildAssembler step generates a lot of warnings fromResolveReferenceLinkComponent stating "Unknown reference link target: XXXX". How do I suppress these? If third-party assemblies are referenced by your documented types, you may see warnings about unresolved reference links. All this means is that the topic tried to generate a link to the indicated member but could find no information for it to generate a valid link. In such cases, the member name will be rendered in bold text rather than a clickable link that takes you to its topic. These warnings can be safely ignored. If you find them bothersome, you can add the Additional Reference Links Plug-In to your help file builder project. This plug-in will generate the necessary information to suppress the warnings or generate links to the members if the selected help file format supports it (i.e. MS Help Viewer). See the plug-in topic for more information. My project relies on third-party assemblies and/or interop assemblies that do not have XML commentsfiles. How can I document my assemblies without them?
